definition: finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
surname Yin/abbr. for 印度[Yin4 du4]
to print/to mark/to engrave/a seal/a print/a stamp/a mark/a trace/image

sentences.english: I smiled at the little fingerprints on my mirror. I didn't wipe them off.
sentences.chinese: 我对着镜子上的小指印含笑，没去擦。

sentences.english: That tax bill had the senator's fingerprints all over it.
sentences.chinese: 那张纳税通知单上满是那位参议员的指印。

sentences.english: If the person interrogated refuses to sign his name or press down his fingerprint, it shall be indicated in the notes.
sentences.chinese: 对被盘问人拒绝签名和捺指印的，应当在笔录上注明。

sentences.english: Now Zikao exam, according to the examination room is a fingerprint for identity.
sentences.chinese: 现在自考考试的时候，在考场是要按指印来身份的。

sentences.english: The police can find no finger print or other clue to help them in solving the robbery.
sentences.chinese: 警方找不到指印或其他线索来帮助他们侦破抢劫案件。

sentences.english: The dumb thief left his fingerprints at the crime scene.
sentences.chinese: 那位笨贼把他的指印留在犯罪现场。

sentences.english: She carefully rubbed off the finger-mark from the painting.
sentences.chinese: 她小心地把图画上的指印擦掉。

sentences.english: Any revision of an inquiry transcript shall be confirmed by the inquired parties, with their seals or fingerprints affixed thereto .
sentences.chinese: 笔录中修改处应当由被询问人盖章或者捺指印认可。

sentences.english: Footprints and fingerprints gave a clue to the police.
sentences.chinese: 脚印和指印给警察提供了线索。

sentences.english: It is now ready to roll out and cover with your toppings.
sentences.chinese: 它现在可以弹回来，并让你的指印消失。

sentences.english: She carefully rubbed off the finger-mark from the paint.
sentences.chinese: 她小心地把油漆上的指印擦掉。

sentences.english: The detainee's refusal to sign or press down his fingerprint shall be indicated in the Detainment Decision.
sentences.chinese: 被扣留人拒不签字或者捺指印的，应当予以注明。

definition: trace/impression (e.g. footprint)/abbr. of 印子錢|印子钱[yin4 zi5 qian2], usury
